intro: Mystacidium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its green, leafy stems that can photosynthesize. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers, followed by red berries that are dispersed by birds. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important part of the ecosystem, supporting various wildlife species.
